page.title: 14 BETLEY BONFIRE
page.content: Every year the village hall committee organises a bonfire and firework display.The bonfire is always on the nearest Saturday to November 5th. and it is held on a field of Betley Court Farm behind the village hall. The bonfire is so big it burns all through the night and is roped off so that no one can get too near it.The firework display lasts about an hour and costs over 2000 pounds.A travelling fairground comes and there are usually my hundreds of people there,so many you can hardly move around the fair when the firework have finished. Many people in the village help to build the bonfire and the brownies do the cleaning up next day.They often find a lot of money which people have lost.People come from many miles away, all over North Staffordshire and South Cheshire.
